front.title: A Configuration Profile Schema for LDAP-based agents

abstract.t: This document describes a schema and possible mechanism for distributed configuration of similar directory user agents. This document defines a schema for configuration of these DUAs that may be discovered using the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol. A set of attribute types and an objectclass are proposed, along with specific guidelines for interpreting them. A proposal of using attribute and objectclass mapping allows DUAs to re-configure their schema to that of the end user's environment. This document is intended to be a skeleton for future documents that describe configuration of specific DUA services.
